OOC: Was that perhaps an opening for me and my char?
  ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
  From: Megan Solmonson 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Th=
ursday, May 22, 2003 4:25 AM
  Subject: Loud & Clear



  The hot African s=
un was glaring down harshly onto the armor of the 4 
  Decepticon researche=
rs when Sand Storm finally diluted the last of the 
  incinerated radioacti=
ve core material.
  Spinning his little back tires in vehicle mode to bury =
what was left of 
  their ship with fertile earth that would grow over with=
 long African grass. 
  Leaving the plain natural once more. In time.

  Bu=
t for today, everything was over as far as work was concerned. And the 
  l=
ittle dune buggy transformed into robot mode before he plopped down in the =

  grass and fell backwards. Until he looked up into the sky.
  His ligamen=
ts had never been so sore in all of his entire LIFE! He was a 
  researcher=
, not a labor bot!
  Oh well...it hadn't been like he'd done all of the wor=
k himself. So everyone 
  was probably just as bushed as he was.
  But the =
more and more Sand Storm thought about work, the more tired he got. 
  So h=
e decided just to look at the pretty clouds as they floated by. Trying 
  t=
o make shapes out of them in his mind.
  Which was kind of...fun.

  Diesel=
 Runner and Blue Flame, meanwhile, were trying to come up with the 
  best =
action to which to do next. As Dark Cloud looked over what had been 
  salv=
aged earlier from their ship. When it had been whole, that was.
  "Well, we=
 both know that we can't stay out in the open for too long. So 
  shouldn't=
 we head for the nearest brush?" Blue Flame suggested as he 
  surveyed the=
ir surroundings.
  Although D.R. just gave him a strange look. " Show me a =
patch of brush on 
  this plain that's large enough to shelter two semi-tru=
cks. One of which with 
  a cargo tailor large enough to hold the first, mi=
nd you."
  Blue Flame grinned. " You know, that's not a bad idea. Dark Clou=
d, Sand 
  Storm and myself can take turns getting out of this heat in your=
 air 
  conditioned trailer..." he trailed off sarcastically.
  And got a g=
ood punch in the shoulder-plate for it too as the fembot beside 
  him glar=
ed dangerously. " Yeah! While I drive around trying to find shelter 
  for =
ALL of us, you lazy clout!"

  Suddenly Blue Flame's comm-system flared to =
life and both he and his 
  Commander jumped. A voice blaring over the soft=
 sounds of the plain.
  "What the Pit?!" D.R. snarled, not liking to be sur=
prised as the other semi 
  looked just as shocked.
  Sand Storm sat up a b=
it away from everyone and eyes his sub-commander. " I 
  thought our comms =
were down."
  " Me too." Blue Flame answered, but a look at D.R. made up hi=
s mind for him 
  on whether or not to answer and he opened up the link to =
reply.
  " Copy. This is Blue Flame of the Decepticon research vessel Nosvo=
no 
  [<Noss-vo-no>]. We've just crash landed and are in need of assistance=
. 
  Over."

  ____________________________________________________________=
